question.text: Read the following statements and find the incorrect one.

options.text: Saliva is mainly produced by three pair of salivary glands.
Salivary glands are situated just inside the buccal cavity.
Hepatic lobules are the structural & functional unit of the liver.
Most of the water is absorbed in the large intestine from the food reaching it.

solution.text: Submandibular glands are located on each side of the jaw below the jawbone. Sublingual glands sit on the bottom of the mouth under your tongue. Additionally, hundreds of small (minor) salivary glands deposit saliva from ducts around the mouth. These glands situated just outside the buccal cavity secrete salivary juice into the buccal cavity.
